question: my daughters says her vagina smells?
question_content: My daughter is 12 and she says her vagina smells she bathes everyday. She also says gooey clear stuff is coming out her vagina and no she doesn't have her period. What does that mean please help me thank you very much and have a blessed day.

answers.answer_content: The clear gooey stuff is just discharge no need to be worried there. But as for the smell that could be a problem there&#x27;s a chance she could have a yeast infection but that would most likely make the discharge a different color and you said it was clear. Try getting her some cleansing wipes for that area and if it continues best bet would be to take her to a doctor to make sure everything is alright down there ..good luck

This happened to me around the same age. As long as the discharge is clear, it's okay. Make sure it's not lumpy-textured though. I'm guessing it's just all a part of puberty and her body may be preparing itself for a period. This started happening to me about a year before my first period.

There are sprays and wipes you can buy at grocery stores and supermarkets. But ask her if she's using soap or not down there, sometimes soap can mess up the PH balance and cause infection, especially when the body is going through puberty. The vagina is self-cleaning, so really all you need is warm water and very gentle, mild-scented soap at the most down there.
The clear gooey stuff is discharge. Nothing to worry about there. But about the smell coming from her vagina you might want to see a doctor. I hope I helped!

That's just discharge that everyone gets. It should only be clear and no other color. For the smell, idk maybe when she uses the bathroom she's not wiping right. Tell her not to wash down there with soap. All she needs is water because the vagina cleans itself out. You can get I think it's called Summers Eve, or something like that. The shower soap that you can use down there, and there is also sanitary wipes she can use to freshen up when she needs to

Take her to the doctor.
It sounds like a yest infection. But have her checkd out.
"She bathes every day…" Tell her not to use soap when she washes her private part- as to not destroy the ph balance there, that is necessary to prevent yeast infections.
Get some fresh yohurt and tell her to put it on it. I heard vinigar works too but it might hurt.
